page.title: 19Farming in all areas.
page.content: Land use in the area falls into two distinct types. Permanent pasture predominates on the wetlands alongside the River Trent grazed by pedigree Fresian dairy cattle. The bulk of the milk is sold fresh in nearby urban centres.In many places medieval strip patterns are clearly visible indicating the absence of ploughing.On the better drained lands away from the river, arable crops and improved pasture is typical.Sometimes the crops are used as fodder for dairy herds.On the Wychnor Estate large areas are given over to wheat.Hedgerows have been widely removed to facilitate modern mechanisation. The practice of straw burning does not seem to be present in the area,farmers favouring baling.
